It is characterized by its unique leaf structure, which features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry riverbeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Olgaea baldshuanica is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
